text: Some people talk about it being boring going up towns in rpgs. I love it if you ask me, taking in the sights, talking to people, getting news items, etc. All whilst listening to music like this.

text:
Reminds me of Legend of Dragoon a bit...

Numara is like a mix of Luca from FFX and those castle towns and world map theme on Disc 2 of Legend Of Dragoon.

text: TEACH ME HOWDA DOUGIE!
author: unirnmes

text: I thought I was the only one who noticed that.
author: farlow126

text: The only thing that bugged me about this game is the color pallet, Uhras capital seemed like it got the Gears of War filter. Especially in Numara everything just seemed too uniform, It was like the whole game was put under a certain filter depending on the area. Not a fan of that "style" but other than that easily one of the best JRPG's this gen.
author: Fahlt

text: If you don't mind me asking, where did you find/get the background image of this video from? This art of Numara is in the strategy guide but I've been looking for digital versions of the environmental concept art from Lost Odyssey and haven't been able to find any yet.

text: this game was really dissapointing IMO. Battle system was just boring, and the story tried to be both serious and silly at the same time and completely failed at either. Only part I really liked was the short stories.
